section.name: Introduction
section.p: From the www.dict.org website: “The Dictionary Server protocol (DICT) is a TCP transaction based query/response protocol that allows a client to access dictionary definitions from a set of natural language dictionary databases.” So, in other words, it's a client-server way to access dictionaries, as well as encyclopedias, thesauri etc.

Several open-source DICT server applications are available, including in Java, but so far no Java client were available. JavaDict-Client is a 100% Java implementation of a DICT client. See the www.dict.org website for server software and various free dictionaries.
